response_parsed.title: Containerizing CLI Tools Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to containerize command-line interface (CLI) tools using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI can be used to expose CLI tools as RESTful API endpoints.
Using Docker and FastAPI makes it easy to deploy and manage your CLI tool as a containerized application.
This approach allows for easier integration with other services, scalability, and cross-platform compatibility.

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi uvicorn
EXPOSE 8000
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000"]

version_notes: Python 3.12 is required for this example.
FastAPI version 0.74.0 and uvicorn version 0.17.6 were used in the provided code examples.
caveats: Ensure that your CLI tool doesn't require user input during execution, as it will not be possible within this containerized setup.
Modify the Dockerfile to fit your specific project requirements and environment variables, if needed.
